Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that members of Congress wore swastikas on their dresses and masks, when in reality, the photo is altered and there are no swastikas in the original image.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on an altered photo that has been debunked by independent fact-checkers.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the altered photo accurately represents the actions of the members of Congress, without providing any evidence or context.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the original photo, posted by Rep. Cori Bush, does not show any swastikas or the added bow.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation is that the altered photo is a deliberate attempt to smear the reputation of the members of Congress who are part of 'The Squad'.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by presenting an altered photo as evidence without verifying its authenticity or accuracy.
